item.title: Report X-2023070793
item.description:
Report X-2023070793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2023070793 SequenceEvent: Package found soiled and set aside for processing. Damage was segregated from other packages. DescribePack: 4 out of 4 gallons were found to be soiled due to 3 of the 4 having loose caps and leaked inside the box. There was only a minor spill. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Damage was segregated from other packages. 2. X-2023070795 SequenceEvent: Package was found soiled and set aside for processing. Damage was segregated from other packages. DescribePack: 4 out 4 gallons of solution were found soiled due to 3 of 4 having loose caps and leaked inside the box. There was only a minor spill. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Damage was segregated from other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023070785
item.description:
Report X-2023070785

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler was unloading Hazmat package and powder spilled out of the package and onto the floor. Package Handler notified Management who then called QA. QA and Manager placed leaky hazmat into a hazmat bag and placed hazmat bag into a hazmat tote. Manager and QA then cleaned up powder spill on floor and placed clean up materials in hazmat bag with the package. DescribePack: One of the bags inside the package had a hole and caused hazmat powder to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat Package was placed inside a hazmat bag to stop source of leak. Package Handlers were asked to stay clear of spilled powder on the floor until QA and Manager cleaned up the powder.

  • City: BLOOMINGTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The pail was discovered with most of the liquid out spilled out of the bucket and was inspected with half of the lid off. In house clean up was performed. Package was placed in a drum to stop the pail from leaking more liquid. DescribePack: The pail was 5 gallons with a lid. Upon inspection the lid was coming off causing the liquid to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pail was placed in a drum to reduce the liquid from spilling out.

item.title: Report E-2023070307
item.description:
Report E-2023070307

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USA experienced a release from a box containing multiple 55-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 75-pounds of product released impacting a 6' x 15' area of trailer floor due to the closure on the bags being loose. Contractors resecured the bags and tightened the closures. The bags were each then placed into their own poly liners to prevent further release. The released product was then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: BLYTHE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 18 pound pail of calcium hypochlorite (un2880) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 6 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: RESPONDER WORE REQUIRED PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE), FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED UP AND REMOVED THE SPILL SAFELY

DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LIGHTLY CRUSHED WITH LESS THAN 1/10TH OF A GALLON LOSS. OTHER HAZMAT PACKAGE SOILED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, one bottle inside package was found with loose cap causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.description:
Report E-2023070273

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG West, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG West, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. The driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer without making sure all of the necessary connections were made. This allowed approximately 10 gallons of gasoline to be released. The customer dispatched a clean-up crew to the site to handle the remediation.
